sen.j: 洞（うつろ）とは、室町時代後期から安土桃山時代にかけて、現在の東北地方及び関東地方の戦国大名に見られた形態で惣領である当主を中心に一族・家臣をまとめた擬似的要素のある族縁共同体のこと。
sen.e: Utsuro was a quasi family-related community that organized family members and vassals with soryo (heir), the head of family, in the center and such organizations were seen from the late Muromachi Period to the Azuchi-Momoyama Period among sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku Period) in Tohoku and Kanto region.

From the late Muromachi period to the Azuchi-Momoyama period, Utsuro was a quasi family-related community that organized family members and vassals around the head of the family, called soryo (heir). Organizations such as these were seen among Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) in the Tohoku and Kanto regions.
sen.cmt: rearranged words and split this sentence into two for smoother reading; fixed grammar
sen.e: Utsuro was a quasi family-related community from the late Muromachi period to the Azuchi-Momoyama period that organized family members and vassals around the head of the family, called soryo (heir); organizations such as these were seen among Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) in the Tohoku and Kanto regions.
sen.cmt: "From the late Muromachi period to the Azuchi-Momoyama period"の位置を移動*訳文が二文に分かれていますが、これに基づき原文を分割するのが困難なためセミコロンでつなぎました。

sen.e: It is the equivalent of bunkoku (provinces that were governed by shugo daimyo or sengoku daimyo in an integrated fashion) that was seen in other regions and can be called "Kachu" in different words.
Utsuro, also called "Kachu," was the equivalent of a Bunkoku (a province that was governed by a Shugo daimyo or Sengoku daimyo in an integrated fashion) that was seen in other regions.

sen.j: 幕藩体制の確立に基づく近世大名への再編成の過程で消滅していったとされている。

It is believed that Utsuro disappeared during the process of a reorganization in Bakuhan taisei (the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate) with the appearance of Kinsei daimyo (daimyo of the early modern era).

sen.e: In these regions, more than one daimyo families that developed from traditional samurai groups existed in a ryoseikoku (province) and their territorial relation was also complicated.
Within these regions, more than one daimyo family developed from traditional samurai groups existed in a ryoseikoku (province) with complicated territorial relations.

sen.j: そのような中で大名たちは一族・更に家臣や周辺の国人領主や地侍たちを従えながら、彼らに対して惣領としての優位性を主張した。
sen.e: Under such situations, daimyo subjected their families, vassals and kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord)/jizamurai (local samurai) of neighboring provinces to their rule and asserted their superiority as soryo.

sen.j: また非血縁関係の家臣・国人領主たちに「一家」・「一門」などの称号を与えて自己の一族扱いをしてゆく事によって組織における指導的地位を確保しようとした。
sen.e: Further, they treated vassals and kokujin ryoshu with no blood relation equally with family members by conferring the title of "ikka" or "ichimon" and made sure of their leading position in the organization.

sen.j: こうした形態は結城氏や佐竹氏、宇都宮氏、小田氏などに見られ、これらの大名間の外交交渉の文書・書簡を見ても「当洞」・「○○洞中」などの表現が見られる（なお、西国でも似たような構造を有した毛利氏の文書中にも「洞」の語が登場するが、特異な例と考えられている）。
sen.e: This sort of organization was established in the Satake clan, the Utsunomiya clan and the Oda clan etc. and the words "当洞" (todo) or "OO 洞中" (OO dochu) were used in the documents/letters of diplomatic negotiations exchanged between daimyo (although the word "洞" was also used in the document of the Mori clan, which was the daimyo of the western region of Japan and had a similar organization, it is considered to be an exceptional case).
sen.cmt: 「当洞」・「○○洞中」 - 読み、定訳不明
sen.e: This sort of organization was established by such clans as the Satake clan, Utsunomiya clan and Oda clan. and the words "当洞" (todo) or "OO 洞中" (OO dochu) were used in the documents and letters of diplomatic negotiations exchanged between daimyo (Although the daimyo of the Mori clan, who was the daimyo of the western region of Japan, had a similar organization and also used the character "洞" in their documents, it is considered to be an exceptional case).
sen.cmt: changed "word" to "character"; fixed grammar and rearranged sentence to read more naturally; capitalzied "Although" since the description is an entire sentence
sen.e: This sort of organization was established by such clans as the Satake clan, Utsunomiya clan and Oda clan, and the words '当洞' (todo) or 'OO 洞中' (OO dochu) were used in the documents and letters of diplomatic negotiations exchanged between daimyo (Although the daimyo of the Mori clan, who was the daimyo of the western region of Japan, had a similar organization and also used the character '洞' in their documents, it is considered to be an exceptional case).
sen.cmt: 文中のピリオド→カンマに修正、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 逆に守護大名の段階において領国の一円支配を一応は完成させていた武田氏や今川氏、新興の外来勢力である後北条氏・里見氏には見られない現象でもあった。
sen.e: By contrast, this phenomenon was not seen in the Takeda clan and Imagawa clan which achieved ichien shihai (integrated rule over whole territory) when they were still in the stage of Shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable) or in the Gohojo clan and the Satomi clan which were the newly emerged foreign power.

By contrast, this phenomenon was not seen in the Takeda and Imagawa clans, which had achieved ichien shihai (integrated rule over whole territory) when they were still in the stage of Shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable). Nor was it seen in the Gohojo and Satomi clans which were a newly emerged foreign power.

sen.e: Tanemune DATE sought to organize even bigger Utsuro by integrating those of the Ashina clan, the Mogami clan, the Tamura clan, the Shirakawa Yuki clan, the Iwaki Clan and the Soma clan through marriage and/or adoption.

sen.j: これは本来伊達氏特有の現象ではなく、この地域の戦国大名家の洞は周辺部にある国人領主たちによる小規模な洞をいくつも包括していく中で自己の洞という形で大名領国を形成していったと考えられている。
sen.e: The above was not particular to the Date clan because Utsuro of sengoku daimyo families in this region is considered to have developed into daimyo ryokoku (territories ruled by daimyo) by integrating many small-sized Utsuro of kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) in neighboring region.

sen.j: この乱を「洞の乱」とも呼ぶのはこの内乱に参加した伊達氏家臣は勿論、一般には外部の戦国大名と認識されている蘆名氏や最上氏・相馬氏などもこの乱の当時においては洞の一員であったからである。
sen.e: The reason why this internal war was also called "the Utsuro War" is that those who participated in this war, vassals of the Date clan as well as the Ashina clan, the Mogami clan and the Soma clan who were generally regarded as independent sengoku daimyo, were the members of Date's Utsuro at the time of war.

sen.j: それでも仙台藩家格の呼称には「一家」・「一門」などの洞時代の主従関係の残滓が残され続けて、これに基づいた家中の上下関係が形成された（ちなみに天文の乱終結から仙台藩成立までに新規に「一家」・「一門」以上となった家は片倉小十郎で知られる片倉氏他1家のみと言われている）。
sen.e: Even after that, however, titles representing the family status in the Sendai domain that derived from the relationship of lord and vassals in the era of Utsuro, such as "ichimon" and "ikka", were continuously used and became the basis of the hierarchical relationship in the domain (it is said that only the Katakura family, which is well-known thanks to Kojuro Katakura, and another one family were conferred the title of "ichimon"/"ikka" or higher during the period from the end of Tenbun War until the establishment of the Sendai Domain).
